author: Beth Gibbons, opinion contributor
description: The Trump administration is already acting to seed any future version of the assessment with climate denialism.
title: Trump gutted the National Climate Assessment. America will suffer as a result.

author: Steph Whiteside
description: Tipping rose slightly for full-service restaurants in the first quarter of 2025.
title: Delaware best in US for tipping, California ranks worse

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The Trump administration is moving to ax Biden-era climate and pollution rules for power plants, EPA administrator Lee Zeldin announced Wednesday.  The moves come as the Trump administration looks to promote a fossil fueled future — and are expected to worsen global warming and air pollution.  The Environmental Protection Agency is proposing to overturn Biden-era rules that…
title: Trump proposes axing Biden’s climate rule for power plants

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Senate Republicans appear less likely to try to make changes to Medicare Advantage as part of their massive tax and spending bill, Sen. Kevin Cramer (R-N.D.) said Wednesday. Cramer raised the idea of targeting Medicare Advantage for additional savings last week after a closed-door caucus meeting, saying the program is ideal for reform because it…
title: Cramer: GOP has no ‘stomach’ for Medicare changes in Trump megabill

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: An appeals court panel took up President Trump’s bid to fight his hush money criminal conviction in federal court on Wednesday, acknowledging the extraordinary prosecution coupled with the Supreme Court’s presidential immunity decision breaks new ground.  The three-judge panel on the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit must decide whether to open a…
title: Judges probe whether immunity decision leads to wipeout of Trump conviction

author: Kamari Esquerra
description: An important deadline is quickly approaching for students heading to college this fall.
title: FAFSA deadline approaching, students urged to seek aid now

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott announced that the Texas National Guard is prepared to maintain order and arrest anyone who harms a person or property, while California Gov. Gavin Newsom's emergency request to limit the troop deployment was rejected.
title: Texas governor deploying National Guard to various locations in state

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: The next members of an influential federal vaccine policy advisory committee will be “highly credentialed physicians and scientists” and not “ideological anti-vaxxers,” Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said late Tuesday.  In a lengthy social media post on X, Kennedy said he would announce the new members of the Advisory Committee on Immunization…
title: RFK Jr says he won’t put ‘anti-vaxxers’ on key vaccine advisory panel

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) posted a Tuesday photo touting the use of National Guard soldiers in Los Angeles following large scale immigration protests.  Two police officers could be seen handcuffing a man while soldiers stood at bay with weapons in hand. Both groups of law enforcement wore bullet proof vests.  Defense Secretary Pete…
title: ICE shows photo of National Guard troops standing by during LA arrests

author: Donna Brazile, opinion contributor
description: Trump might decide to shrink the agency even further with more job cuts, effectively rendering it unable to carry out its duties, as he has done with the U.S. Agency for International Development and other agencies.
title: As hurricane season ramps up, Trump is giving FEMA the USAID treatment

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Protests against the Trump administration’s immigration crackdown are spreading across the United States with several organizations planning to launch demonstrations on Saturday that are meant to coincide with a military parade in Washington, D.C. on the president’s 79th birthday.  The groups No Kings and 50501 have partnered to host protests in a wide range of…
title: Protests of ICE raids spread across US

author: Jared Gans
description: Atlantic City Mayor Marty Small Sr., who is under criminal indictment, has fended off a primary challenge to win the Democratic nomination for a second term, Decision Desk HQ projects.  Small defeated Bob McDevitt, a former longtime head of a casino workers union. He will face Republican Nadeem Ahmed Khan, who ran unopposed in the…
title: Atlantic City mayor wins primary under shadow of assault charges

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump said Wednesday his administration had reached a tentative agreement on a trade truce with China following talks between the two sides in London. As part of the agreement, which Trump said was pending his approval and the approval of Chinese President Xi Jinping, China will supply “full magnets, and any necessary rare earths,”…
title: Trump: Tariffs on Chinese goods set at 55 percent, US to get rare earth minerals in deal

author: Nicholas Creel, opinion contributor
description: Trump's plan in Los Angeles is becoming clear: violate the law brazenly, provoke pushback, then use that pushback to justify further lawlessness.
title: Don’t fall for Trump’s war games in LA

author: Andrew Dorn
description: More Americans are filing for Social Security retirement benefits earlier; here's why.
title: Why are more Americans filing for Social Security benefits?

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) knocked President Trump in a video address late Tuesday, after the Trump administration deployed thousands of National Guard soldiers and Marines to Los Angeles in an effort to quell immigration protests. The governor said while the state is no stranger to immigration enforcement, the administration was not focusing on immigrants…
title: Newsom knocks Trump’s ‘brazen abuse of power’

author: Julia Shapero
description: The Senate is poised to hold another key procedural vote on stablecoin legislation Wednesday, clearing the way for the crypto bill after several controversial amendments threatened to complicate its path forward.  Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) moved to end debate Monday on the updated text of the GENIUS Act, struck as part of a…
title: Senate lines up major step toward passing stablecoin bill

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Sen. Andy Kim (D-N.J.) is backing Rep. Angie Craig (D-Minn.) in the Democratic primary to replace retiring Sen. Tina Smith (D-Minn.), making Kim the latest Democratic senator to back the congresswoman. “In a time when Democracy is under attack and working families are being squeezed from all sides, we need bold, principled leaders who won’t…
title: Andy Kim endorses Angie Craig in Minnesota Senate race

author: Derek Hunter, Opinion Contributor
description: They must be charged under federal law, because local Democrats won't prosecute their own brownshirts.
title: Send in the Marines and prepare to throw the book at every LA rioter

author: Ella Lee
description: President Trump’s hush money criminal conviction returns to the limelight Wednesday as his attorneys plead with an appeals panel to move the New York case to federal court.  The oral arguments will unfold in a Lower Manhattan courthouse down the block from where a jury convicted Trump on 34 felonies last year. It marks the…
title: Trump’s hush money conviction returns to court

author: Jeremy Tanner
description: Among the nation's major restaurant chains, In-N-Out is still supreme when it comes to the satisfaction of its workers, according to a new study.
title: These 10 restaurant chains have the happiest workers, study finds

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) arrested dozens of people on Tuesday after Mayor Karen Bass (D-Calif.) enforced a citywide curfew following sweeping protests to local raids by Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). Local officials said the downtown Los Angeles-area would be restricted from 8:00 p.m. to 6:00 a.m. after law enforcement took nearly 200…
title: LA police make arrests as curfew goes into effect
